Triggering Event: He found himself alone in the ER, the weight of the day's shifts pressing heavily upon him. The phone rang, an unfamiliar number flashing on the caller ID. He picked up, "Hello?" His stomach churned as he listened, the reality of his worst fears coming true.

It wasn't like he'd been taking care of himself; in fact, he'd been complaining about how tired he was, even though they both knew he'd rather stay home and watch TV than get out there and work. Why did he always have to be so lazy? And what about all those late nights spent drinking? Wasn't he supposed to be watching over his dad instead of enjoying every last drop of beer? As he rushed through the emergency room doors, he couldn't shake off the feeling that everything would've been okay if his father hadn't made such a big deal about needing help. If he'd just kept working like normal, none of this would've happened. Now he was going to have to miss a whole week of work, all because of his own lack of motivation and poor choices.
